attributes.action: restructure income tax bands to reduce tax on lower salaries and increase it on higher salaries
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Given the vast differences in salaries in the UK, we need a greater number of tax bands to prevent low- and middle-income tax payers from being proportionally worse off in comparison to people earning "super" salaries. Currently, someone on a salary of £33,301 and someone earning £250,000 pay the same amount of tax (40%), placing a disproporionately high tax burden on the lower earner.

At the moment the UK only has 3 tax bands: 

Starting rate of 10%
Basic rate of 22%
Higher rate of 40%

Currently, people earning more than £33,301 pay income tax at 40%. 

It is proposed that the threshold for higher rate taxation should be raised to at least £50,001, and that there should be an additional "super high" 50% taxation on people earning more than £100,001. 

People earning between £2,151 to £33,300 pay basic rate tax at 22%. This rate should be divided to make the bands more evenly distrubuted. Therefore it is proposed to reduce income tax for those earning under £20,000 to 15%, and increase to 25% the income tax on people earning between £20,001 and £50,000.
